clinical_study.brief_title: Does Echocardiographically Guided Ventriculo-Ventricular Optimization Yield a Sustained Improvement in Echocardiographic Parameters in Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy Patients? (DEVISE CRT)
clinical_study.official_title: Does Echocardiographically Guided Ventriculo-Ventricular Optimization Yield a Sustained Improvement in Echocardiographic Parameters in Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy Patients? (DEVISE CRT)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether using an echocardiogram (a painless test where ultrasound is used to see your heart) while using mild electrical stimulation from your own CRT-D device to stimulate the ventricles (the lower chambers of the heart) to squeeze one slightly earlier than the other will show a sustained increase your heart's productivity (Cardiac Output (CO)), following implantation of a Cardiac Resynchronization Device (CRT-D). We believe that squeezing some parts of the heart earlier than others may make the heart a stronger pump.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine if a sustained hemodynamic benefit of increased Cardiac Output is maintained in patients who undergo ECHO guided optimization of V-V timing following CRT implantation when compared to patients simultaneously biventricularly paced.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment for improvements in 1)6 minute walk 2)ECHO parameters 3)symptoms as assessed by the Minnesota Quality of Life Score.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. LVEF </= 35% as assessed by echocardiography.
2. New York Heart Association Functional Class III or IV CHF despite contemporary medical therapy for CHF.
3. QRS duration of >/= 120 ms.
4. Ability to provide written, informed consent.
5. Age > 18 years.
6. Successful implant of a biventricular/ICD pacemaker device.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Documented Chronic Atrial Fibrillation
2. Life expectancy less that 6 months due to non-cardiac causes
3. Inability to place a coronary sinus left ventricular pacing lead
4. Pregnancy
5. Scheduled cardiac surgery within the next 6 months
6. Prosthetic Tricuspid Valve
